content.description: Boulder name: Lonesome boulder.   When approaching the boulder you will notice the edge of near a tree. You will begin the route a left crimp, right hand slope and good feet. The crux would be moving from the start to a right inset pocket, just to finish the route!
The crux is the very top of the boulder. Full two handed mantle on a sloper ending hold.
content.location: farther left side of Lonely Boulder (on face, facing road). Easy climb down.

content.description: Along River Road in Wimberley you will find several semi-hidden boulders on the right side of the road headed up river. These are past the low water crossing near 7A resort. The boulders we particularly climbed on are in a bunch of shrubbery of thorns and trees. The potential to tread climb on the cliffs behind these boulders also seem  like a lot of fun! These boulders are hard limestone and the cliffs are mix of hard and soft, brittle limestone. (a piece fell off while climbing)
